term.title: polyaddition

item.text: A polymerization in which the growth of polymer chains proceeds by addition reactions between molecules of all degrees of polymerization.

notes.item: The growth steps are expressed by: Px + Py → Px+y {x} ∈ {1,2,\,...∞};{y} ∈ {1,2,\,...∞} where Px and P_y denote chains of degrees of polymerization x and y, respectively.
The earlier term 'addition polymerization' embraced both the current concepts of 'polyaddition' and 'chain polymerization', but did not include 'condensative chain polymerization (in polymers)'.

sources.item: PAC, 1996, 68, 2287. 'Glossary of basic terms in polymer science (IUPAC Recommendations 1996)' on page 2307 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199668122287)
